meanings.definition: Crowned with laurel as a mark of honor or distinction.
meanings.sent1: The victor was laureated for his exceptional performance.
meanings.sent2: She felt proud to wear the laureated crown on her head.
meanings.sent3: The cat looked quite laureated with the toy mouse on its head.
meanings.sent4: The sun, like a laureated king, shone brightly in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The tree, laureated with colorful leaves, stood out in the forest.

meanings.definition: Decorated or honored with a laurel wreath.
meanings.sent1: The laureated athlete smiled as he received his award.
meanings.sent2: The statue in the park was laureated with a beautiful wreath.
meanings.sent3: The cake, laureated with candles, looked too pretty to eat.
meanings.sent4: The old building, laureated with ivy, had a charming appearance.
meanings.sent5: The door, laureated with a festive garland, welcomed guests warmly.
